title: 100% Convinced ARAM has...
body: to be reworked to allow all champions to be picked. Seeing the same champions over and over again has ruined this game mode. I had the most fun with ARAM during the first 3-4 months of it, now? It's a toss up and a gamble. I can't win against teams with super poke or super sustain. It's obnoxious and I'm getting sick of it. Please at least balance it out. You nerfed healing, AWESOME! This would throw off my calculations in my other comment on this thread.

The entire game is meant to be fun and not taken seriously.  And yet people do care.  Just because you seem to think ARAMs are less "serious" than any other mode does not mean that ARAM should be a mode that people actively exploit to win.

Let's say a person owns 1 champion - Jayce. 
Now let's assume that they want to have Jayce every ARAM game.

If Jayce is in the Free Champion Rotation, they have a 10% chance - that's a lot - of getting Jayce in an ARAM.
If Jayce is not in the Free Champion Rotation, they have a 9% chance - still a lot - of getting Jayce in an ARAM.

For one champion, that's a large chance when compared to, if you have the entire champion pool of 123 (as of the date of this post, 20/1/2015) champions, which is about a 0.8% chance. It's 10x more likely they'll get Jayce.

Those odds are way too easy to exploit via ARAM smurfs.

**Note that these percentages are theoretical.**

Yes.

They are people who only buy champions like Jayce, Nidalee, Blitzcrank, etc. Aram winners.

Now, let's say you unlock 10 out of the top 15 champs in aram. Worst-case (no overlap with free champs), you're at a 50% chance of getting one of them. 

Now, look at the list of free champs available in any given week and pick out what's *good* for aram (not top-tier, but generally something that's pretty solid). It's always set up to be capable of building two standard SR teams. Most likely, the available supports will be alright for aram. Any Marksman is useful to have in aram. The mid-lane mages are likely to be okay picks. So really, only 4 out of the 10 free champs (junglers an top laners) are more or less up-in-the-air. Though it is often nice to have something to act as a solid front line on the team, too.

Still, if there's only 4 champs of the free week pool that you actively *don't* want for aram, that means the other 16 you've got a chance of getting are *at least* good, if not top-tier, which makes for a pretty solid 80% of your available pool.
Add in rerolling and it becomes guaranteed.

That's kind of touchy and muddies the math a little bit, because you'd also have to somehow factor in that they get rerolls less frequently. This could be worked out but I really don't feel like it right now. 

But to your point, I at least like to see a tweak to the reroll formula put in. Perhaps they could get rid of the base 30 reroll points you get per game, so it's *only* based off the number of champions you own. It would make it take significantly longer for these accounts to get a reroll. Or, to not punish newer players playing ARAM, make it 30 - summoner level + total champs owned.

Actually you can make it almost 100% guaranteed by doing these:
1) Create account with only OP ARAM champions.
2) Join ARAM, if you didn't get OP champion - reroll.
3) If you still didn't get OP champion - dodge.
4) Now there is a penalty for dodging, but you can easily bypass it by creating few smurfs accounts and switching between them. It shouldn't be that hard, there are thousands of bots leveling fresh to buy accounts (just join Dominion game right now, if you don't believe me).

It's just sad reality of ARAM in these days and yet Riot still doesn't react...

Nerf poke? No. Make it less common to get near-perfect team comps by making all champs available? Definitely. 

ARAM is pretty much the only reason I play anymore, and it has gotten stale. As much as I love the new map and having an actual queue now, ARAM smurfs combined with the re-roll system have made it extremely frustrating to play now.

I feel the biggest problem with ARAM is how damn long it takes to get into a game, due to tryhard whiners dodging every match until the champ composition is no longer "random". Out of re-rolls? Don't like your random champ? Team composition not optimal? Just dodge and try again! Ugh.

But...I think that's kind of the fun.

I think of it like Ranked fighting games in which you don't know against whom you'll be playing. Sometimes it's just a counter-pick to your character, it happens, especially in fighters. (Baraka does not want to fight Sub-Zero. Scorpion does not want to fight Shang Tsung. Elizabeth definitely does not want to fight Sho. No one wants to fight Dante for any reason because he has no weaknesses. And so on.)

Granted, matches last a lot longer in ARAM, but I like the challenge if you kinda get screwed a bit. Sometimes we end up with four supports and a fighter.

And sometimes you pretty much win at champ select. I got Blitzcrank once...With Kalista, Lucian, Varus, and Jinx. Yeah, that went as you'd expect.

But it's like mystery skins, kinda. You just don't know how it'll really end up. Even if they "win" champ selection, that doesn't necessarily mean they're any good as that particular champ, you know? I've seen plenty of lousy Threshes and Fiddlesticks.

By 'all champions to be picked', we don't mean let people pick their champion. That'd be awful and no longer ARAM. What we mean is to make the entire champion pool available to all players, so they can't manipulate the random to give them a greater chance at a top-tier champion. 

I agree that part of the fun *is* in working with the team you get, and figuring out how to deal with the other team. But because of ARAM smurfs (and partially rerolls as well), you really only see the same subset of champions all the time right now.

Here's an idea, on ARAM, the more champions you have, the LESS LIKELY you are to get a free-week champ?  I know that is kinda already the case, but what if it was implemented MORESO (like a bonus extra chance).  This way if you're, say running a ARAM-based account, it'd be more likely to choose a champ you don't have (like if you own 7 champs or less?) and guide you to a free week champ.  Not to say that this will happen 100% of the time, but here's the reasoning.

For ARAM, if you don't have a lot of champions, it's a good way to kinda see and experiment with champs you don't normally play as (free week).  When you DO have quite a bit of champions to choose from, you show versatility (for the most part) and that you don't rely on a specific small range of champs.

Seems overly complex and outside the spirit of ARAM. Opening up the full champion roster to everybody would be far simpler and even more effective.

Then, if they choose to leave re-rolls in, they can leave the re-roll point gain mechanism the same as it is now, so it would actually give players a true advantage by owning all the champions.

Just like the complaints with iTunes feeling "not random enough" when it was completely RNG-based.
"We want things to be less random so they only *seem* more random."

I'd love to see this.  I suspect Riot might be worried that the mode would sub for buying them, but I wonder.

I would expect a bit of QQ over people getting, say, Poppy or someone they can't play (which is silly, she's actually quite good vs. squishy teams... I've carried hard with her on ARAM).
Leave the reroll point system exactly as it is today, and you actually give ARAM players *incentive* to unlock all the champs.
